remarks.para: One symmetrical pair may be inoperative in down position provided:

numlitem.para: Ground spoilers are verified to be operative once each flight day,
Anti-skid system is operative,
Flaps 1 takeoff operation is prohibited,
Aircraft remains at or below FL300,
Airspeed does not exceed 270 knots or .70 Mach, whichever is lower,
Autoland operation is prohibited,
Autospoiler operation is prohibited for landing, and AOM decrements are applied, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.
Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Autoland operation is prohibited.
For landing, do NOT place spoiler lever in the "ARM" detent.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: SPOILER amber light on the overhead panel will be illuminated and the SPOILER message on EICAS will be displayed.

For landing with flight spoilers inoperative, the aircraft nose should be lowered to the runway before REVERSE THRUST is applied, preventing spoilers from deploying before the nose gear is on the ground. With the nose gear on the ground, the crew should not experience pitch changes that may occur when spoilers are deployed.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.
Takeoff Weight Reduction
- Reduce Takeoff Structural Weight limit to 217,000 lbs.
- Takeoff Weight Reduction -3200 lbs. to Runway Limit Weight
Flaps 1 takeoff not authorized.
Landing Weight Reduction - see the destination airport analysis for Max Landing Weight with Manual Spoilers.
Anti-skid system must be operative.
Minimum field length is 6,000 ft.
Limit flight altitude to FL300 or below.
Airspeed restricted to 270 kts or M.70 or less.
Autoland operation is prohibited.
Autospoiler operation is prohibited for landing and manual spoiler weight limits are applied.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "SPOILERS NO’s X and X INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Each flight day, ensure that all operative spoilers operate correctly (no more than one symmetrical spoiler pair inoperative):
Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
